Privacy Policy Walmart–Employees that suck!, Rude Customer Service and Untrustworthy Employees! By missmegzy13
Everytime I have to go into Walmart I cringe. The only reason I shop here is because its the only store in town. I never know anyone when I go there and I always feel like an outsider. As pissed as I was having to go there last night, I had to return because the cashier had told me I had gotten all my bags, when in reality, I really did not. So I had to make a second run to Walmart. In my head I was thinking“Oh great, I wonder what crappy customer service employee I will deal with into today?”
As I approach the customer service desk, I showed her my receipt and she acted like I had stolen these items. She then gets her“book”of what was known as“go backs”. This clearly was not good. I bet you can guess what happens next. I had to go back and find all of the items that the cashier did not give me the night before. Not only was I mad and pissed off, I still had to stop at the photo department to pick up my photos because they close at a 8. What photo department closes at 8??
After finally getting the items back, as I was walking my baby had slipped his bottle throught the holes of the cart, and it had landed on the floor. The bottle had hit the floor and the formula went everywhere. I was looking for an employee to ask where paper towels would be, but that was a joke. When I had found paper towels, you wouldn’t believe that three employees had walked passed me, watched me clean the spill up, and never ever said one word!!!
Your Ad Here
Continuing onwards to the photo department, I had gotten to the counter and came across a sign that said to go get an employee to get your photos. Well now I am really pissed off. So go figure, its a joke trying to find an employee. After 10 minutes of finding the photo associate, he came over to find my photos. I looked at the pictures, which came out horrible, so I gave them back to him. I tried to explain to him that they did not come out well, and he just stared into space and did not even listen or make eye contact.

I was finally able to get out of there and now I have a major migrain from the stress. It was a nightmare, therefore I try to avoid Walmart as much as I can because the employees are so rude there and they never want to help a customer out! My recommendation is that if you want good customer service you avoid Walmart!

Wal-Mart is a unique place and a very unique environment. They have low, low prices but they also have low, low wages for their employees. Only the head manager at each store makes a decent salary ($100,000). Everyone else gets paid dirt. And then of course you have the CEO, CFO and COO all making millions and millions of dollars.
The average employee at Wal-Mart makes so little they qualify for welfare and live way below the poverty line. You cannot work at Wal-Mart and support yourself at the same time. It’s just not going to happen. I worked at Wal-Mart while I was going to school because I couldn’t find another job and didn’t really need to make a lot of money because I lived with my parents.
But once I graduated from college I immediately quit my job from Wal-Mart because they wouldn’t promote me and I went to work for their competitor Target. Target started me at $42,000 a year–Wal-Mart assistant managers don’t even make close to this. Within a year or two they said that I should be a manager at one of their stores. This means I’ll be making around $150,000.
This is why target stores are nicer, cleaner, neater and have better employees. They pay more money–it’s as simple as that. Wal-Mart hires the dregs of society and pays them as little as they can legally get away with. You get what you pay for.

Having experienced horrible customer service at Wal-Mart myself, I can totaly understand the dread associated with having to be there when you would rather be somewhere else.
I have to say this, and I’m not trying to be rude, but it seems as though YOUR attitude was just as bad as the employees can be. If I were a Wal-Mart employee I would have avoided you, too.
Keep in mind that it is NOT the employees fault that the photo center closes at 8 pm. It is also not the employees fault if they cannot sit in the area they are working because, chances are, they are off trying to complete another task that was requested of them while you were waiting or looking for one. And I understand that there are employees who are sometimes off playing around or running their mouths. That still does not give you an excuse to have a horrible attitude. Chances are they hate the place as much as you do. But at least they are working and not being a drain on society without a job at all.
Sorry your experiences were terrible, but try being a bit gentler yourself and you will be very surprised of the results.
